Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChristophJ99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 6 days. The whole hotel stuff is very friendly. And all our requests have been answered promptly. Our room was superb, also was the breakfast. The hotel is well situated between Hippodrome and KÃ¼cÃ¼k Ayasofia Mosque. Nearby are the Sokollu Mehmet Pasha Mosque and the new Istanbul Photography Museum in Kadirga District. We recommend the hotel and will stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fuegolatino22
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small and quiet oasis in the heart of Sulthanamet, Istanbul. Just a few minutes walking distance away from the blue mosque as well as of the sea. The hotel staff is well organized (pick up service from the airport) and very friendly. The room we had was nicely furnished. The hotel has a very nice garden lounge, the whole interior nicely decorated. Breakfast buffet is delicate.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sivarj61
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here twice during our trip. The guys at the reception desk were fantastic, especially Tariq. They really do get the meaning of customer service. Room was tidied up and bathrooms cleaned. However, the free drink packets and sugar were not refreshed. Something to improve upon. The hotel is within walking distance to the Sultanahmet Square, approximately 10 minutes. There are several good local restaurants and cafes within a 10 minute walk radius of the hotel, so you can always get a bite to eat. Ask the front desk for info. Also the breakfast spread has a wide variety to choose from. All in- top value for money.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Banu G
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul every year and this time wanted to stay in the heart of old city istanbul. It was my first time at the hotel and was very impressed. I would like to mention the warmth of the staff and to mention the beautiful room i was staying really superb and very clean. The decor of the hotel is the best i have seen anywhere in istanbul. I would highly recommend this hotel for the person who wants the best. I would definitely stay there on my next visit and have advised all my friends and relatives. AND the breakfast was the best too. Bani from Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ros-Herts
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sokullu Pasa while on a trip of the museums and historic sites in Istanbul. Most of my colleagues were at another hotel, which was fully booked, so it was chance that I chose this hotel - but I was delighted that I had done so. My 3rd floor room was very nice, and unlike another reviewer, it was also very quiet. The room and en suite bathroom (with lovely big shower over the bath) were always extremely clean, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. For some reason I couldn't get internet access in my room, but otherwise I have absolutely no complaints. The price, through booking.com was also very good value. The staff were friendly and helpful; by mistake I left my mobile phone, and they very kindly arranged fast shipping back to the UK for me (but be advised - for some reason Turkey won't allow sim cards to be returned to the UK, so I have had to arrange for a new one). The hotel is only a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome, so is well located. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and certainly stay there again if I come back with family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela261
Reviews.Content: There was nothing I did not like about the Sokullu Pasa Hotel. The friendliness and efficiency of the staff, the sheer opulence and beauty of the hotel, the location, the cleanliness and size of the rooms, the breakfast menu selections, the value for money - all in a word, 'fabulous'! I will highly recommend this hotel to all, and will certainly look to re-book if I re-visit the wonderful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros C
Reviews.Content: I want to emphasize that the staff was extremely polite, friendly and helpful. If I will ever return to this hotel, it will be only because of the staff. I thank them all. In the hotel there is no isolation so the guest can hear everything even from the reception! PLEASE avoid the first floor rooms!!! The whole night you will hear this huge iron entrance door slamming and it will be impossible to sleep unless you use medication!!!! My room was not well cleaned every day. They didn't vacuum, they didn't refill the mini bar etc. One day I asked them to change late in the afternoon my sheets and towels. After I return at night, I was asked(not very politely) to pay extra for this service. Of course I denied to pay and finally they accepted it

Reviews.Title: “Mat&Stany”
Reviews.Author: Mat_Stany
Reviews.Content: Location, room, staff are simply great. We wanna come back on summer to Sokullu and i raccomended this place to everyone!! <3

Reviews.Title: “Great stay Thanks007”
Reviews.Author: Kcon2202
Reviews.Content: Great location and sensational room. Very friendly and helpful staff - good fun. Have recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok.”
Reviews.Author: Pietro S
Reviews.Content: fantastic location just few meters far from the major acctractions. Extremely clean, very good breakfast with lots of turkish food. Staff very friendly. A really great 'small and nice' hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fearns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sokulla pasa for our second time and enjoyed our few days there very much. The location is walking distance from the Blue Mosque and other attractions.The hotel is spotless and staff very helpfull.Happy hour was an added bonus Hope to stay there again on our next visit to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Masudah
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul three times now and this is the best hotel I've stayed in thus far. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, and made me feel at home from the outset. Breakfast was a divine spread, rooms and decor very tastefully furnished and accommodation very comfortable. Great extras in the bathrooms! I would definitely return to Sokullu Pasa Hotel. Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay in the great city!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel located in old town”
Reviews.Author: MSCInnsbruck_Austria
Reviews.Content: Really great location, very clean rooms, very friendly staff, excellent breakfast ...

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdfan
Reviews.Content: This place is welcoming from the first moment. It was a circuitous ride from the airport and so it was a relief to step into the cool and very Turkish lobby. There was a problem with my reservation, but the hotel resolved it to my satisfaction and I spent my week there in the sea view balcony room on the third floor. The room was really comfortable, with a jacuzzi bath/shower, excellent and generous amenities, great towels and bathrobes, good coffee maker, comfortable and stylish bed reminiscent of a harem, safe, minibar, and tv. The breakfasts were copious and delicious, with hot selections, breads, juices, cereals, mezes. I happened to get a cold while there and it was a very comfortable place to hang out for a day and recuperate. I had lunch in that day and it was very good and stylishly presented. The hotel had a personal touch that I felt through my stay and especially upon leaving, which was not easy! And its location was terrific. It was just down the hill from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, so it was super convenient in Sultanhamet, which seems to me the choice area to stay in, yet it was a very quiet and peaceful location, whereas mere blocks away could be very different. Altogether, this was a charming hotel that elicits warm feelings from its clientele and is a peaceful and comfortable spot to stay mere steps from most sites you will want to see in daytime and nighttime.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded - Pays to Go in the Offseason”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel that my fiance and I stayed at in Istanbul. It was great to be upgraded to a junior suite when we arrived. The staff was very friendly and the accommodations were very comfortable. Only downside is that there was a mosque directly outside of our window, so the call to prayer was very clearly projected into our room. That being said, with thousands of mosques in Istanbul, I'm sure that's a problem pretty much everywhere. Overall, a great stay, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Gregor W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sokullu Pasa Hotel for four nights. The hotel is located in the centre of the historical district of Istanbul, just in walking distance to the main attractions. Our room was amazing! Lovely decorated, very clean and equipped with everything you need to feel at home. The included breakfast offered a great variety of typical turkish and international food. The restaurant is worth trying. Especially the pasta is like a poem! The best "thing" to mention is the friendliness of the staff. They treated us like family, were always helpful and made our stay a wonderful experience. Thank u all for taking care of us D&G

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic Hotel with Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: MadaBill
Reviews.Content: We were unsure where to stay, we decided that old instanbul would be the area we wanted to stay in, travel guy in Turkey recommended it. We checked the web site and took a punt on it, what a great decision. Coming in from the airport we were a little worried as the bus stopped in a side street as the roads were thin and steep. Do not be concerned by the facade, as soon as we walked in we were met with friendly and effecient staff and the inside of the hotel opened up with a great ambience. Fettah greeted us and we were sat down and given a briefing on the hotel by the lady on reception (sorry I cannot pronounce your name!!!!), bags were previously delivered to our rooms The rooms were very well appointed and furbished, bed comfortable, blinds as well as curtains, good air conditioning, all mod cons including a fantastic toiletries package, shower scrub, toothbrush and toothpaste was a great touch as I had forgotten to pack mine!! Gels or soaps, shaving kit etc. The contents were replaced daily Free wireless internet throughout the property in either rooms or common areas Tour desk at recepteption and staff forever trying to make our stay as comfortable as possible, whenever we were in the hotel we felt like we were at home with our Turkish family, this included all staff, nothing was too difficult a task for the crew, a big thank you to all of you, you made the difference between a good or great holiday, after the hustle and bustle of our days it was great to come back to the hotel and feel like it was our home away from home Breakfast was also very good, great way to start the day, from fruits, condiments, cold meats, cheeses, cereals, cooked food also delicious breads with a cuppa just the way we liked it, made a sensational start to the day Not a big hotel but value for money you could not go wrong, in the centre of the old city, walking distance to near attractions and tram (one way was grand bazaar the other Taksim and everything in between, easy to get tokens as well for the tram), walking distance to restaurants and bars as needed, if the tour desk was not enough in the hotel, several tour shops were within 100 metres of the hotel As we were a little late on our arrival, we decided to eat in the first night, well what a delight of a restaurant (see my other review on restaurant), so you could eat in or out, your choice

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TouringClancys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in March 2011. On arrival, the friendly desk clerk spend half an hour sitting down and discussing options for our day trips without trying to sell us anything! Room had ambiance for reasonable price. If you are allergic or sensitive to perfumes, don't stay here as the linen was heavily perfumed. The room was also quite (overly) warm. The central heating had no in-room control. It is an uphill walk to the Blue mosque (approx 750m) and further up the hill to a tram stop. For healthy travellers, this is no problem, but if you will struggle on cobblestone roads on a slope, then this hotel won't suit. We would definitely stay here again because it offered excellent value for money (and we loved Istanbul). Breakfast downstairs each morning was good.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: RandiLD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, cozy and, most importantly, just a stone's throw from most of the major tourist attractions in Istanbul. The Blue Mosque, for example, is just a five minute walk. Employees are friendly and helpul and the restaurant is quite good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Layla81
Reviews.Content: We knew it was a four star hotel in the old city, but we bought it as part of a package so we thought it should be OK. We didn't expect it to be this gorgeous, or the staff to have this much warmth and charm. The decorations really get you in the mood for Turkey and all the history, and the people are just gorgeous. We'll be recommending this to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and conveniently located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: agkluis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within five minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Hippodrome. This means that it is very close to all the major attractions within the old city. The proximity of the major tram line on Divan Yolu Cadessi, means that access to the west and north are very easy. There are numerous restaurants closeby. We felt safe walking back late at nights. The rooms are small but clean and adequate. The daily breakfast is substantial with a good variety of choices, western and local. The staff clearly work very hard and are always polite and helpful. We found that the airconditioner could not keep up with the summer heat. If we returned to the hotel in the afternoon at the hottest time of the day, the unit was inadequate to cool the room. The temperature was fine at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful--would stay everytime”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet91
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel in the central touring area, yet on a quiet street. The staff is both highly professional and very friendly and responsive. The rooms, while not large, are large enough with good closets and great bathrooms. Wifi worked without a problem;. The building itself is historic (500 years old) yet totally remodeled last year. Garden courtyard on two levels.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid hotel in a magic city”
Reviews.Author: Sonia_Chowdhury
Reviews.Content: We found Sokullu Pasa Hotel accidently during our tour in Turkey . And this hotel is one of our memorable souvenirs of the country .It's hard to beleave how a hotel could mark your mind and be unforgettable , but it was simply marrvelous. Situated in the old town ,the hotel has a perfect location . Extremely close to many of the important tourist sites of Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace ,Aya Sofya,Grand Bazar, spicy bazar, and many bars and restaurents accessible by foot from the hotel . We couldn't imagine better location for discovering the historical and majestic Sultanahmet area...there are lots to see . The tram stop is only five minutes from the hotel which could be an easy way to move and visit if you don't like to walk . When we entered to the hotel ,we were charmed by the high standard Ottoman style decoration , as if each detail was created with passion and Love ...style, design,colours, nothing missed out. It is so elegent that you will be seduced !!! Our room was magnificent , spacious,clean ,cosy and very comfortable , i felt like a princess . On a nice and charming terrace we had breakfast , very tasty with many choices . In addition to the great location and the standing , i was moved by the exceptional warm welcoming of the staff and the service which make this hotel UNIQUE. I can't say enough about the extreme kindness and professionalism of the staff . I travelled in many countries but never felt it , i was really surprised . Everyone was helpful and concerned by your well being . Nothing was too much effort to satisfy you . Always welcoming ,smiling ,and warmhearted ,they provided us useful informations and guided in our plans .They did so much for us and made our stay amazing . Now i understand why the turkish hospitality is world famous . I would like to thank all staff for making our stay enjoyable ,especially to Diana , Erhan and Fettah who made us feel at home and not in a hotel . And congratulations to the management for having created a hotel environment with the qualities mentioned above. I strongly recommend Sokullu Pasa Hotel to everybody who wants to have an unforgettable stay and for sure i will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: hartkristopher
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here for three nights, left for a week to see more of Turkey, and made sure to return again for another three nights! I couldnt wait to get back to Istanbul, and see our friends and room again at this hotel. From the very second we showed up to the last minute of our stay; the staff was beyond friendly and helpful. The place was very well renovated, super clean, and an awesome location.It took us a maximum 10 minutes to walk to the big mosques. The major dining area is about 10 minutes away as well. The breakfast was included, it was very good with piles of variety. But what makes this hotel special, is of course again the staff. Never without a smile, and always going the extra mile! Fettah/Ibrahim, and Acelia, you guys are the best! They were great even before they learned that it was our honeymoon. After that, it was world class service! We were so impressed! Thanks again guys. Kris and Shannon!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: atina_11
Reviews.Content: A beautifull hotel ideally positioned for exploring the city. Near all major attractions full of tradition and local color. But the most important piece of this hotel were the people, the staff! They are so friendly and so willing to help you that you feel like home.Congratulations to all of them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with very helpful staff, and more...”
Reviews.Author: Budapest09
Reviews.Content: Actually, I was supposed to stay in another hotel, next door, but because the room I had booked was occupied, and I had rejected the other hotel rooms they proposed (because my criterias were sea view and balcony, as per my booking), the hotel owner offered me to be moved to the Sokullupasa hotel. I was put in a very nice room (last floor suite, not really a suite, but HUGE room, with a small terrace and a wonderful sea view). I enjoyed it very much. ++: hotel overall, staff, my room, breakfast, I was proposed an ipad during my stay (for free) if I wanted to use internet!!! Hotel owner speaking French. A nice small restaurant down the street (cheap and good. Avoid tourist places). A small bakery next to the restaurant with Baklavas to kill for!!! --: I prefer fresh juice for breakfast (because I had to say something). Very little international channels on TV (seem to be usual in Turkey).

Reviews.Title: “great location, walking distance to all historical sites and markets”
Reviews.Author: huys25
Reviews.Content: For our few days in istanbul we were upgraded to a suite with a king size round bed under skylights and having next a giant jacuzzi, rainshower and own hamam. The Hamam was so nice that we did no have time to sit in the jacuzzi, and the rainshower had so much water that the drain almost could not work it. The location was excellent, all major historical building attractions at walking distance, the fish restaurants and the main bazar /spice bazar on the other side, also walking distance. The ATMs in front of the Aya Sofia and near main bazar. Taxi to and from the airport was simple and efficient. Quit location. Probably no parking. We never hear the mosks screaming, but maybe we slept to good. Reception was very helpful and received good instruction/advice. Breakfast was reasonable, but no fresh eggs and many sweet cakes, etc. Nice interior patio, but not a roof-top terrace. The patio-terrace is at groundfloor level.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, 5-Star Service at an affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie1913
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveler, I was a little nervous about my first trip to Istanbul. To my surprise, I was warmly greeted at the airport by the gentleman from the transfer service. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, I felt like I was visiting old friends. Check in was very fast and easy. Before putting my bags away, AÃ§elya and Fettah were kind enough to inform me of nearby sights, and things to do in Istanbul. They readily gave me this information without having to be asked. I was very impressed by that. The hotelâ€™s location is excellent for tourists. The room was immaculately clean, with well-appointed interiors. The interiors provided so much character to the space. After traveling all the way from Texas, I appreciated being able to take a hot shower, with excellent water pressure. To top it all off, the bed was an absolute dream! I enjoyed the free Wi-Fi. Each morning there was a filling breakfast served with lots of variety. Next time, I will request a room a little further away from the breakfast area. I found that I could hear every little sound in the morning. It wasn't worth complaining about, as everything else was perfect. Each evening as I returned from my activities, I was greeted by name and with a smile. Everyone on staff at this hotel seemed to be poised and attentive. I had a very early morning departure flight. AÃ§elya offered to have some breakfast packed up so that I could take it with me. Wow! I should mention that a mistake had been made in regards to my payment at check out. Fettah apologized, and promptly rectified the situation. He even helped me get all of my bags to the car on my way to the airport. That is what I call 5-star customer service! I was impressed by everyone at this hotel from the beginning to the end. I canâ€™t recommend this hotel highly enough. I would like to thank all of the staff for making my first trip to Istanbul unforgettable! I am looking forward to my return!

Reviews.Title: “Room very tiny”
Reviews.Author: pantagruelParis
Reviews.Content: This is a welcoming little place in central Sultanahmet. The only objection I have is that some of the rooms are tiny even by the standards of Sultanhamet boutique hotels. My room did not even have a chair and nowhere much to put a case/hang clothes.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel experience in a unique town!”
Reviews.Author: PerO1944
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the first time in 1976 and have returned to this magic town more than 20 times over the years. We have seen how the number of good hotels have increased and especially the number of new beautiful butique hotels in the Sultanahmet district. For our spring break this year we chose to stay in Sokullu Pasa Hotel on the recommandation of Turkish friends. From the moment we entered the front door it became a wonderful experience due to a very welcoming and friendly staff. The hotel has recently been upgraded and today it is exceptionally beautifully decorated in the Ottoman style. We wanted to make the stay something extra this time and had chosen one of the two suites, the "Harem Suite" In addition to a huge, comfortable bedroom with a round bed which could have belonged to a sultan, the suite had a beautiful bathroom with a jacuzzi, a seperate toilet, and a seperate shower. But the highlight of the suite was the private Turkish bath (Hammam) in grey marble with colourful Isnik tiles. The suite had now windows, but it did still have enough air and light as each of the rooms had several domes in the ceiling. We travelled with another couple, who chose the other suite : The Bosphorus suite. They were just as satisfied as we, as they in addition to a marvellous room also had a small balcony with an incredible view over the Bosphorus and the Marmara Sea. The Breakfast buffet was first class and was included in the rate of the room. Apart from the beauty of the hotel and the good service we must also point out the perfect location only 4 minutes walk away from the Blue Mosque . The hotel is situated in a small sidestreet without traffic noise in an area with small wooden houses. Some of these are now turned into hotels, but the majority of the houses are still used as family homes. It gave us a unique feeling of experiencing the real Istanbul in a way we have not had before in the Sultanahmed district. It is a hotel we really hope we will have the chance to return to in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Valery112
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The location is perfect. The interior was wonderful.The stuff was very helpful, very friendly, always smiling. They provided always useful information. The staff made our stay in Istanbul more pleasant. I would recomend this hotel to everybody. Very good quality for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel With Wonderful People!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yannis-Zoi
Reviews.Content: Sokullu Pasa was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed.When we entered in,we were very charmed by the ottoman style decoration and the warm welcoming.Taking advantage of a special March offer we were upgraded into a superior room instead of a standard double.Our room was indeed fantastic.It was spacious, with a lot of light,very clean and silent and full equiped.The bed was orthopaedic and with clean sheets.Moreover the room had a breathtaking vista in the Marmaras Sea.Considering our breakfast,that was delicious.It consisted of food with ottomanic influences together with european style breakfast.Furthermore each day there was a Â«new entryÂ»in the sweets menu(one day homemade profiterol,the other chocolate cream or rice pudding).But mostly,above all,what will always remain unforgettable in us, that you will not find even in a 5 star famous hotel, is the quality of the people that run the hotel.They have welcomed us with a warm hug and an endless smile.We felt as being at home and we made new friends.They were interested in the way to facilitate our tour(restaurant proposal,commuting ideas,shopping tips)in Istanbul and solve any possible problem.We were talking for hours exchanging our ideas and feelings and we felt very close.Many thanks to Ozgur,Murat,Fettah,Erhan,Azelia,Diana,Siebel and all the other unforgettable and helpful staff.We hope to see you all soon because we already miss you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pinstep
Reviews.Content: Gayan, Sibel, Yusef, Fettah and the two others that work the front desk were amazing!! When I was inside I was really treated like family. No where else have I experienced that and they were all so helpful all the time.. My trip was memorable because of them.. When I go back to Istanbul I will be sure to book again with them.. Worthwhile stay, from the decor (stunning), the food (great), the setting (perfect) etc... Just lovely..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent conditions and Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra1966
Reviews.Content: I have found Sokullu Pasa Hotel by the chance walking by after being already checked in another hotel nearby where I was very unhappy with the state of room (though I have booked this hotel following Trip adviser good references). I met very pleasant and helpful staff of Sokullu Pasa who shown me available rooms in this newly renovated hotel. Next morning I moved to Sokullu Pasa hotel, and spent 3 happy days in Istanbul. Location is great: in a middle of the old city and close to the main Istanbul attractions, restaurants and Bazars; rooms, bathrooms, furniture all new and comfortable. I am highly recommending this hotel: excellent balance quality-price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: _inga_azov
Reviews.Content: Excellent and cosy hotel, very clean, relaxing atmosphere, nice location - very close to main historical sights. Staff is highly professional, friendly and helpful. Breakfasts are perfect, very tasty, wide choice of dishes. We really enjoyed staying in the hotel, hospitality of people working here. Sending our warmest regards to Mustafa, Yusuf, Acelia and all staff who made our vacation so wonderful. During our next trip to Istanbul we will definately chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Lacoruna0123
Reviews.Content: Sokullu Pasa is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. Small and historic building, 10 mintues walking from Blue Mosque and Santa Sofia. The staff is so nice, the room very charm, clean and cute. Thank you Erhan and the rest of staff for giving us an unforgetable stay. I will recommend it to all of my friends

Reviews.Title: “Charming little place-- great value, and very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Beesterdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sokullu Pasa for 2 days, and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The hotel is really cute. It's in a 400 year old building, but has been renovated. It has a Turkish flair to it, yet it's not overdone. The rooms are beautiful and the bed was really comfortable. They have free breakfast in the mornings, and the spread is impressive. I expected it to be more limited but fortunately it wasn't. The staff was great, and it was truly a great value for the money. The rates are super reasonable, and you really feel like you're in a more expensive place. The staff is super helpful and they made our stay as pleasant as they could. The location is good-- 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and 10 minutes to Topkapi palace. Only thing is there is no night life or late night dining within walking distance. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sokulla Pasa; A family away from home”
Reviews.Author: SJBAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: I decided last minute to cancel my transfer flight and stay in Istanbul for my entire vacation. This meant that I had no place to stay and needed to book a hotel at the airport. The agency was very kind and after some discussion I chose Sokulla Pasa based on their location and price. Sokulla Pasa is a short walk from some of the major historic sites. The blue mosque, St. Sofia, Egyptian Spice bazaare and lots of shops, cafes and restaurants. More importantly are the wonderful people that have worked hard to make the Sokulla Pasa feel like a home away from home. The staff were warm, welcoming and went out of their way to assist in anything that I needed. They provided helpful information and took the time to answer any questions I had over a hot cup of tea and Turkish cookies :) The buffet was simple and fresh, with great service. Although the space was bit ackward in the bathroom with the positioning of the door and toilet, the room was a nice size for one person. The restaurant, located in the basement looked out into a nice garden through a wall of windows, accompanied with original brick walls from the Ottoman Empire. I imagine this would be quite enjoyable in the summer months. My trip to Istanbul was more than I could have imagined, and my stay at Sokulla Pasa made it all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: aboodalhabib
Reviews.Content: actually i think this hotel is nice hotel i was in istanbul for one day so i booked a room in this hotel i arrived before the sunrise and because its just one days i dont want to sleep i sat down in the lobby and the man who work as recepation made a coofe for me he was so nice with me then i leave to my room the room was perfect and you will not miss any thing inside it (( i mean its include every thing )) they told me about the breakfast and its from time to time but i went out early to see istanbul and when i ask the reception she gived me alot of information about the city then i back late and i think the breakfast time finished but when i arrived there was nice breakfast with nice servece mmmm what can i said about this hotel i think its nice hotel and its one of the best place i visited in istanbul i will not forget it and i will not forget the people who works there becsause really really they were so nice with me

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel iv styaed in”
Reviews.Author: chantelle123
Reviews.Content: iv been to istanbul more than 5 times and this was my 1st time in this hotel and i can honistly say how beautiful this hotel is every think about it was just soo perfect t firstly the staff were very nice and always seemed happy,there was always staff on the front desk you never had to wait around,the lobby is very beautiful good place 2 sit and have a drink with friends family ect: the rooms where lovely also and they was so comfitable. the cleaness of the hotel was at a very high standerd also.the restrant was a plesant place to eat, the food was very good and staff was very on the ball and talk good english to and good for money.when i visit istanbul agine i will be staying here agine i highly recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “best of the best”
Reviews.Author: dorotii6
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Sokullu Pasa Hotel in Istanbul and would like to say that the staff at this hotel are among the best that I have experienced in all my years of travel. Its very good place to spend some time with your friends or for the whole family. The hotel is extremely comfortable ,food is excellent and the staff were courteous and helpful at all times. The most important: excellent location (very close to Hagia Sofya) clean, modern hotel,friendly staff on the whole, excellent room. THE VALUE FOR MONEY IS EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean Hotel with family flair, i prefer this Hotel for my next trips to Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: xxrayxx
Reviews.Content: It's really a good choice to visit Sokullupasa Hotel. It will be good to get Airport-Transfer as a special service for Ã  flat fee for example. I ll visit that Hotel again - very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Oriental, very Friendly yet Elegant (small) hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Zoltan_J
Reviews.Content: excellent location for leisure travellers, central yet quite and by Istanbul means vaue for money. the staff and managers extremely helpful and friendly. freshly renovated, the lobby, the room decoration, the view from the terrace is just an extended visit to the Sultan's court (be reasonable). needs a finished dining though (may have finished by now). no spa

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: hatun00
Reviews.Content: It is a very great hotel, with very friendly personal and very nice and clean rooms. The food is very delicious, I will always come back into that hotel and enjoy istanbul Thany you for your the nice time... :-)))))

HotelInfo.Name: Sokullu Pasa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Mah. Sehit Mehmet Pasa Sk. No:3 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
